Smart features: A remote control with built-in Wi-Fi and Bluetooth capabilities, enabling users to control smart devices such as lights, thermostats, and security cameras from a single device.
Motion sensors: A remote control that can detect movement and adjust settings accordingly, such as automatically turning off the TV when the user stands up to leave the room.
Multi-device compatibility: A remote control that can be programmed to control multiple devices, such as a TV, cable box, and sound system, eliminating the need for multiple remotes.

Virtual and augmented reality integration: A remote control that can be used to control virtual and augmented reality experiences, allowing users to interact with digital environments and objects in real-time.
Personalization: A remote control that can be customized with different skins or designs, allowing users to personalize their device and make it stand out.
